title: After last night's defeat, the PM's deal faces death by a thousand wrecking amendments
text:
Brexiteers should not get too excited about the belated victory on the Second Reading

What a pitch of parliamentary obscurantism we have descended to when the typically intelligent and engaged British voter – those legendary Worcester Women and serried ranks of Men on the Clapham Omnibus - cannot be sure whether Boris Johnson won or lost overall in the Commons last night, or indeed whether we are any closer to leaving the European Union.

We have certainly worked out by now that a gruelling and vicious tug of war is underway, but so dense is the procedural undergrowth in which it is currently being waged that it is hard to discern whether the Prime Minister gained another few yards of ground...
description: Brexiteers should not get too excited about the belated victory on the Second Reading
